title: The market for street art is getting increasingly challenging
description: On April 15, Artcurial will present over 200 works by Shepard Obey Fairey, known for his 'Marianne' and his campaign in support of Barack Obama.

title: France: 8 people missing in collapse of building in Marseille
description: An investigation has been opened for involuntary injury, at least initially sidestepping possible criminal intentions.

title: Thousands of opposition supporters protest in Georgia against government
description: The ruling Georgian Dream party's government faces accusations of jailing opponents, silencing independent media, covertly collaborating with the Kremlin and leading the country astray from its EU membership path.

title: From alleged North Korean spy to forced retiree, the downfall of one French Sénat official
description: In 2018, Benoît Quennedey, a senior civil servant and the president of a Franco-Korean Friendship Association, was placed under investigation over spying suspicions. Judges later dismissed his case, but the 47-year-old was forced to retire regardless.

title: Multiple dead in French Alps avalanche
description: Four people were killed and more injured in an avalanche near Mont Blanc in the French Alps.

title: Marseille experiences 'a shock like an earthquake' after building collapse
description: Five people were injured after a building collapsed in France's second-largest city. Rescue workers are looking for survivors

title: Ramadan: Across Europe, rules vary for footballers breaking fast during matches
description: On March 30, the French Football Federation (FFF) reiterated its opposition to referees briefly interrupting a game for the iftar. In other countries, match officials are more flexible.

title: Daniel Barenboim: 'The best advice I've ever been given: Play in public'
description: The Argentine-born conductor is known for his work with the West–Eastern Divan Orchestra, a Seville-based orchestra of young Arab and Israeli musicians, and for his strong criticism of Israeli occupation of Palestinian territories.

title: Benjamin Ferencz, last living Nuremberg prosecutor, dies at 103
description: At 27, the American prosecutor secured convictions for 22 Nazis. For much of his life, he advocated for the creation of an international criminal court.

title: Argentina: Historic drought is destroying agriculture and threatening the economy
description: Scorching temperatures and a lack of rainfall are affecting agricultural production. The South American country's dependence on the grain sector is once again under the spotlight.

title: Ramadan: The complex case of fasting footballers, caught between faith and duty to perform
description: Some Muslim footballers decide not to fast on matchdays, some say they play better when fasting, and one was dropped by his coach for insisting on fasting. Every year, football clubs look for ways to adapt to their players' religious beliefs.

title: Pope Francis sends Easter prayers to Ukraine and calls for 'trust' between Israelis and Palestinians
description: In his traditional Easter message of peace, the head of the Catholic Church focused on some of the world's major conflicts.

title: French rappers show support for pension reform protestors
description: On April 9, a group of rappers including Hatik, Sniper, Médine and Souffrance will perform for a solidarity concert to raise funds for the national strike fund.

title: US authorities investigate possible leak of confidential documents on social media
description: The leak concerns classified information on Ukraine, the Middle East, China and South Korea. But its extent, exact origin and authenticity remain unknown.

title: Health Minister Braun: 'Accompanying death is not the same as granting death'
description: François Braun speaks for the first time about assisted dying, as France takes step toward legislating on the question.

title: Will Assad's impunity extend to drug trafficking?
description: The Assad regime controls the production of Captagon and its trafficking to Saudi Arabia, despite the kingdom's willingness to normalize relations with Damascus.

title: Charles Michel's expensive and polluting air travel
description: The European Council president's travel expenses are much higher than his predecessors'. One reason is his taste for flying on private jets, including for short trips.

title: Paris gallery selection: Megan Rooney at the Thaddaeus Ropac, William S. Burroughs at the Semiose
description: This week's must-sees: The first solo exhibition in Paris of the painter; and the very contemporary works of the American writer.

title: Thomas Piketty: 'Can we trust constitutional judges?'
description: Constitutional courts are precious and fragile institutions, but are sometimes instrumentalized, the economist writes in his column.

title: In Germany, Pope Francis gets caught between reformers and conservatives
description: Under pressure from the faithful outraged by sex scandals, local bishops have agreed to reflect with the non-religious on reforming the Church's governance in Germany. In the Vatican and elsewhere, these proposals are worrying.

title: In the Philippines, Senator Imee Marcos revisits history in her movies
description: Imee Marcos, the eldest daughter of dictator Ferdinand Marcos and sister to President Bongbong Marcos, has been producing films to 'explain her family's point of view' on historical events, including the murder of opposition leader Benigno 'Ninoy' Aquino in 1983.
